class_notes:
Greek 202. Poetry (Homer's Iliad)
An introduction to Greek epic poetry through close reading of selections from Homer's Iliad. The goal of this course is to learn to read Homeric Greek with facility and appreciation and to discuss the poem, its interpretation, history, and influence. In addition to reading selections from the poem in Greek, we will read the entire Iliad in English as well as selected essays and articles on a range of topics relevant to the poem.
Texts: 1. A.R. Benner, Selections from Homer's Iliad; 2. a translation of the Iliad (the Lattimore translation is recommended as most useful for students of Greek due to its faithfulness to the original).       
 
Requirements: classwork, quizzes, two hour exams, and final.
Prerequisite: GREEK 201 or equivalent. Students with the equivalent of a full year of college level Greek (Greek 101-102 or Greek 110) may be eligible; consult Louise Pratt (lpratt@emory.edu) if you're uncertain.
course_description: Spring. Selected reading in Homer's Iliad or Odyssey, with attention to poetic art as well as grammar and syntax.
